summary: Feature request to enhance OpenTelemetry span instrumentation to include workflow and activity inputs/outputs as span attributes for better observability and analysis in tools like Datadog.
userImpact: Users cannot currently include activity/workflow input and output data in OpenTelemetry spans, limiting observability and analysis capabilities in monitoring platforms.
proposedFix: Add optional `attributes` field to `InstrumentOptions` to allow passing `SpanAttributes` to span creation, with optional global `includeAttributes` configuration flag in interceptor initialization.
workaround: Manually set span attributes in custom interceptor implementations using `span?.setAttributes()` method as shown in community responses.
resolutionDetails: Community provided workaround through interceptor implementation pattern; issue appears resolved through documentation/sample updates.
keyQuote: Looking at the opentelemetry sdk, `tracer.startActiveSpan` has another available signature where you can pass in a `SpanOptions` object and this has a field called `attributes`
